corpus.title: Well-Ordering Principle
corpus.description: The well-ordering principle states that every non-empty set of non-negative integers contains a least element.

corpus.title: Existence of Modular Inverse
corpus.description: Modular inverse of a mod n exists iff gcd(a, n) = 1

corpus.title: Divisibility
corpus.description: If a = b*k for some integer k, then b divides a.

corpus.title: Integer Division Theorem
corpus.description: Let a and b be integers, with b > 0. Then there exist unique integers q and r such that a = b*q + r and 0 ≤ r < b.

corpus.title: Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic
corpus.description: An integer can be written as a product of primes in a unique way.

corpus.title: Euclid's lemma
corpus.description: If a prime divides the product of two numbers, it must divide at least one of those numbers.

corpus.title: Coprime
corpus.description: Two numbers are coprime iff 1 is the only positive number which divides both of them.

corpus.title: Euler's Theorem
corpus.description: If a and n are coprime, then a^phi(n) ≡ 1 (mod n), where phi is Euler's Totient Function.

corpus.title: If x divides ab and x is coprime to a, then x divides b
corpus.description: If a number divides the product of two numbers and is coprime to the first number in the product, then it must divide the second number in the product.

corpus.title: Modular Equivalence
corpus.description: a is equivalent to b mod n iff n divides (a-b).

corpus.title: GCD is the smallest Linear Combination
corpus.description: The gcd of two numbers is their smallest positive linear combination.

corpus.title: gcd(a/d, b/d) = gcd(a, b)/d
corpus.description: gcd(a/d, b/d) = gcd(a, b)/d

corpus.title: Inverse of a group element is unique
corpus.description: Inverse of a group element is unique.

corpus.title: Condition for a subset to be a subgroup
corpus.description: Condition for a subset to be a subgroup.

corpus.title: Conditions for a subset to be a subgroup
corpus.description: Conditions for a subset to be a subgroup.

corpus.title: Identity of a group is unique
corpus.description: Identity of a group is unique.

corpus.title: Group
corpus.description: A group is a set along with a binary operator which satisfies certain properties.

corpus.title: Inverse of product of two elements of a group
Subgroups of a cyclic group
corpus.description: For an infinite-order cyclic group <a>, subgroups are <a^k> for all k. For a cyclic group <a> of order n, subgroups are <a^k> for all divisors k of n.

corpus.title: Order of elements in cyclic group
corpus.description: Order of elements in a cyclic group.
